author: Robert Quillen

author: Aristotle

author: Francis Quarles

author: Lee Iacocca

author: Thomas Jefferson

author: Joel Osteen

author: Thomas a Kempis

author: Mark Twain

author: Plato

author: Jessamyn West

author: Austin O'Malley

title: Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent.
author: Isaac Asimov

title: I shall allow no man to belittle my soul by making me hate him.
author: Booker T. Washington

title: People won't have time for you if you are always angry or complaining.
author: Stephen Hawking

title: He who angers you conquers you.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

author: Laurence J. Peter

author: William Congreve

author: Douglas Horton

author: Richard M. Nixon

author: Baltasar Gracian

title: You reclaim your power by loving what you were once taught to hate.
author: Bryant H. McGill

author: Benjamin Franklin

author: Dick Armey

author: Louis L'Amour

title: Anger is a short madness.
author: Horace

title: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
author: Confucius

author: Rose Kennedy

author: Albert Einstein

author: Mahavira

author: Jack Layton

title: Your anger is a gift.

author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

author: Charles Bukowski

author: L. Lionel Kendrick

title: These movements aren't about anger. We're not angrily saying 'Black Lives Matter.' We're declaring it. It's a declaration. We want to be seen as robust, full human beings that have anger and have joy. We want to be able to just freely have that joy. Like everybody else does.

title: I'm fascinated by rap and by hip-hop. I think there's a lot of poetry in it. There's a lot of anger, a lot of social energy in it. And I think you'd better listen to it pretty carefully, 'cause it's important.

title: My passion and energy get mistaken for anger.

title: You have to understand the Newark Riots - a lot of people understand that the pain was the initial explosion of anger and alienation, but after that, the response, sending the National Guard troops - a lot of violence was carried out and perpetrated by those who were allegedly coming here to protect residents.

title: We are losing sight of civility in government and politics. Debate and dialogue is taking a back seat to the politics of destruction and anger and control. Dogma has replaced thoughtful discussion between people of differing views.
author: James McGreevey

title: Anger is energising. The opposite of anger is depression, which is anger turned inward.
author: Gloria Steinem

title: We're taught to be ashamed of confusion, anger, fear and sadness, and to me they're of equal value to happiness, excitement and inspiration.

author: Jane Goldman

title: Hatred, anger, and violence can destroy us: the politics of polarization is dangerous.

title: Envy, propelled by fear, can be even more toxic than anger, because it involves the thought that other people enjoy the good things of life which the envier can't hope to attain through hard work and emulation.

title: We must recognize that anger only agitates and incites. It cannot squelch or satisfy the hunger for justice.

title: As much time and effort, emotion, anger, love, joy that you put into another human being, you're not guaranteed to receive that back. And that's OK. That's alright.
author: Logic

title: Anger is an all-consuming fire that will burn you and everyone else around you. Where is the justice in that?
author: Afeni Shakur

title: I don't think you can create art out of anger; it has to come out of some form of understanding. You have to feel good about who you are and that you could do something to change things.

title: Anger is wonderful. It keeps you going. I'm angry about bankers. About the government.
author: Terry Pratchett

title: Depression, suffering and anger are all part of being human.
author: Janet Fitch

title: Too much self-centered attitude, you see, brings, you see, isolation. Result: loneliness, fear, anger. The extreme self-centered attitude is the source of suffering.
author: Dalai Lama

title: I feel truth, beauty, love, grief, anger, intimacy & alive in my body... Women in the global south live in their bodies much more than we in the global north. author: Jodie Evans

title: You have to be sincere in your feelings. And fear is one of those, sometimes; doubt is one of those; jealousy, anger - all your emotions are not going to be considered the strong emotions; all of them are not going to be love, happiness, joy.

title: You must never be satisfied with losing. You must get angry, terribly angry, about losing. But the mark of the good loser is that he takes his anger out on himself and not his victorious opponents or on his teammates.

title: I don't think enough players channel the energy of the crowd. If it's done properly, and you don't let anger overwhelm and distract you, it's like a shot of adrenaline in the arm, and it gets the crowd pumped up.
author: John McEnroe

title: I've been on investigations where a spirit is channeling through me, and I have extreme changes in my emotions - anger, sadness, confusion. Then I begin seeing visions that are not mine. author: Zak Bagans

title: A theme that has always interested me is how women express anger, how women express violence. That is very much part of who women are, and it's so unaddressed. A vast amount of literature deals with cycles of violence about men, antiheroes. Women lack that vocabulary.

title: Forgiveness isn't just the absence of anger. I think it's also the presence of self-love, when you actually begin to value yourself.

title: Quite a lot of our contemporary culture is actually shot through with a resentment of limits and the passage of time, anger at what we can't do, fear or even disgust at growing old.
author: Rowan Williams

title: Appearance is something absolute, but reality is not that way - everything is interdependent, not absolute. So that view is very helpful to maintain a peace of mind because the main destroyer of a peaceful mind is anger.
author: Dalai Lama

title: It's that evil twin part of me that always comes out at the absolute wrong political moment, like a demon possessing my soul; it exhibits itself as an arrogance or disdain or obnoxiousness or meanness or anger or pettiness - all traits that are lethal in politics.

title: I believe anger is a wasted emotion, and I don't like to waste emotions.

title: It was less in pity than in anger that the world was moved by the photograph of little Alan Kurdi, that dead three-year-old Syrian refugee boy whose name we're all remembering now on the first anniversary of his drowning, along with his five-year-old brother Galip and their mother Rehanna.

title: My father was so very afraid. I felt it in the sting of his black leather belt, which he applied with more anxiety than anger, my father who beat me as if someone might steal me away, because that was exactly what was happening all around us.

title: I realized that if my thoughts immediately affect my body, I should be careful about what I think. Now if I get angry, I ask myself why I feel that way. If I can find the source of my anger, I can turn that negative energy into something positive.

title: I'm an angry person, angrier than most people would imagine, I get flashes of anger. What works for me is working out when it's useful to use that anger.

title: You look at 30 Seconds to Mars, and you don't think, 'Ooh, I bet they're angry.' No one really does anger these days. I suppose it's a turn-off.
author: Peter Hook

title: Some days, 24 hours is too much to stay put in, so I take the day hour by hour, moment by moment. I break the task, the challenge, the fear into small, bite-size pieces. author: Regina Brett

title: In high school I dated a white woman. She would come to visit me on the rez. And her dad, who was very racist, didn't like that at all. And he told her one time, 'You shouldn't go on the rez if you're white because Indians have a lot of anger in their heart.'
author: Sherman Alexie

title: I'm not as angry as I used to be. But I can get in touch with that anger pretty quickly if I feel my space is being invaded or somebody is not treating me with the respect that I think I want.

title: I have all bad days. I think I need help. I got an anger problem.
